pageContext.claim: “It was not a campaign contribution, and there were no violations of the campaign finance laws by me. Fake News!”
pageContext.analysis: Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to violating campaign finance laws at Trump's direction when he made payoffs during the 2016 campaign to women who alleged they had affairs with Trump. The hush-money payments were violations of the law because campaign spending is regulated. You can only accept money under certain conditions, you can only spend that money under specific conditions, and that spending needs to be reported.
